bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to L.H. Baekeland, May 7, 1924

div1.p: Howard informs Baekeland that he does not wish to be involved in the controversy between Marie Gorgas and Kean.

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to L.H. Baekeland, May 7, 1924
div1.opener:
FROM L. O. HOWARD
OR LUCY HOWARD
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE,
Bureau of Entomology,
Washington, D. C.
May 7, 1924.
(COPY)
PERSONAL
Dr. L. H. Baekeland,
American Chemical Society,
247 Park Avenue,
New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Baekeland:
div1.p:
Yours of the 5th has just come. It is very courteous of
you to submit the note to me before sending it out for publication.
While the statement is perfectly correct, you will greatly oblige
me if you do not send it in, at least in its present form. I do not
wish to appear as taking any part in this controversy.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, (Signed) L. O. Howard,
Chief of Bureau. loh-wft
